[Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/.60pp.2Emvars.60.20forbidden.3F/near/449666047)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [423103fae4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14491/commits/423103fae42818f4206f97db180a7e6a8ec29423)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh short <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/no_lost_declarations.sh <optional_commit>
```
</details>

I think this text is fine. An alternative would be 

"This `set_option` command should not be committed as part of a PR. Before submitting a PR, please remove the `set_option`. (It will cause the PR to be rejected in CI.)

:v: adomani can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Another suggestion: "Setting options starting with 'pp', 'profiler', 'trace', or 'debug' is not allowed in contributions to the Mathlib project. Before submitting a PR, please remove this 'set_option' command."

Thanks for doing this; I find the new message clearer! Let me join the word-smithing bikeshed: what do you think about
`set_option {name}' is only intended for development, not for final code: therefore, it is not allowed in contributions to the mathlib project.`

I arrived at this phrasing because
- it does not name the list of all options (I don't view this list as exhaustive; I imagine it could go stale quickly)*
- it avoids the jargon-y terms "PR" or "CI" (which are not quite the point imho: a direct push to mathlib master with this option would be just as undesirable)

I am not fully happy with this mentioning `mathlib` at all (in downstream projects, this is slightly misleading). One *could* have different errors for mathlib and downstream:
- in mathlib, take on of the proposed phrasings
- downstream, just say "please consider removing this option"

* For instance, I have toyed with the long-term goal of also making it outlaw `autoImplicit` in most of mathlib (i.e., enforcing what is currently said in code review): this is a different kind of forbidden option.

I just pushed yet another version of the message:
```
warning: Setting options starting with 'debug', 'pp', 'profiler', 'trace' is only intended
for development and not for final code. If you intend to submit this contribution to the
Mathlib project, please remove 'set_option trace.profiler.output'.
note: this linter can be disabled with `set_option linter.setOption false`
```

I like explicitly mentioning what the rules of the linter are, hence the message contains `'debug', 'pp', 'profiler', 'trace'`.  This list is embedded in the code in such a way that the natural way of modifying it will also update automatically the message, maintaining it in sync.

I agree with the desire to avoid PR and CI in the message, but I think that mentioning `Mathlib` is important, since when submitting there the command should be removed.

I like mentioning explicitly also what exact `set_option` was used and the "please remove ...` does that.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9832793009/job/27142097676)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9832793009/job/27142097766)

```suggestion
               If you intend to submit this contribution to the Mathlib project, \
               please remove 'set_option {name}'."
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: soften `set_option` linter message

Build succeeded:

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9832793009/job/27142097766)
